summary: Completed frontend testing of IB Commerce multi-module navigation structure. All navigation requirements verified: 1) Login works with demo@innovatebooks.com/Demo1234, 2) Workspace shows left sidebar with Workspace/Solutions/Reports, 3) Solutions dropdown shows all 6 solutions (IB Commerce, IB Intelligence, IB Workforce, IB Operations, IB Capital, IB Finance), 4) Commerce top nav has Parties/Catalog/Revenue/Procurement/Governance (NO Bill/Collect/Pay/Spend), 5) Revenue dropdown shows 5-stage workflow (Leads/Evaluate/Commit/Contract/Handoff), 6) Procurement dropdown shows 5-stage workflow (Requests/Evaluate/Commit/Contract/Handoff), 7) Finance module has Bill/Collect/Pay/Spend, 8) Intelligence module accessible via solutions dropdown with Analytics/Reports/Insights/Forecasts.

issues: Shows 'Failed to load expenses' error - likely API issue, not navigation issue

commerce_navigation.note: Bill/Collect/Pay/Spend correctly NOT in Commerce navigation

pages_tested./finance: PASS - Finance Dashboard with KPIs and Quick Actions
pages_tested./finance/spend: MINOR ISSUE - Shows 'Failed to load expenses' error

critical_code_review_comments: Navigation structure is correctly implemented - Bill/Collect/Pay/Spend are in Finance module, NOT in Commerce
Revenue workflow has 5 stages: Lead → Evaluate → Commit → Contract → Handoff
Procurement workflow has 5 stages: Procure → Evaluate → Commit → Contract → Handoff
Intelligence module is accessible via Solutions dropdown in sidebar, NOT as top nav link
All 6 solutions are available in the dropdown: IB Commerce, IB Intelligence, IB Workforce, IB Operations, IB Capital, IB Finance
context_for_next_testing_agent: Navigation structure has been verified and is correct. Key points: 1) Bill/Collect/Pay/Spend are in Finance module (NOT Commerce), 2) Revenue has 5-stage workflow (Lead/Evaluate/Commit/Contract/Handoff), 3) Procurement has 5-stage workflow (Procure/Evaluate/Commit/Contract/Handoff), 4) Intelligence is accessible via Solutions dropdown in sidebar. Minor issue: Finance Spend page shows 'Failed to load expenses' error.
